description.narrative: By 2020 health workers have competencies to deliver quality integrated health services to mothers and new-borns in the five priority regions., which contributes to Child Health, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 health workers have competencies to deliver quality integrated health services to mothers and new-borns in the five priority regions.

description.narrative: 11,922 pregnant women and 7,975 newborns received home visits by the trained and equipped community-based health workers (CBHW). Among them, 2,004 women and 338 newborns were referred to health facilities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of UNICEF supported health facilities offering delivery services with functional newborn resuscitation equipment (functional bag and mask in neonatal size)
Percentage of CHWs trained and equipped to provide care for pregnant women and newborns in the 5 priority regions
Percentage of pregnant women (15-19 years old) benefiting from 4 prenatal care visits in the priority regions with the lowest coverage rates (Boucle du Mouhoun, Centre-Nord, Est, Nord and Sahel)
% of mothers and newborns having benefited from a home visit by a community health worker in the 5 regions.
